intro: Oreomyrrhis plicata, commonly known as the pleated gromwell, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, pleated leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Oreomyrrhis plicata thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Its unique foliage and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
